summary: Email chain from August 13, 2019, discussing forensic evidence and coordination regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails involve discussions about obtaining the original ligature for comparison, setting up a call with the medical examiner, and the inability to reliably determine time of death.

persons.name: David
persons.context: A person was reached out to regarding whether to obtain the original ligature used on Epstein for comparison.

persons.name: Dr. Graham
persons.context: Spoken with at the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME); said he would set up a phone call with Dr. Roman.

persons.name: Dr. Roman
persons.context: A phone call was to be set up between investigators and her to address issues regarding Epstein's death.

connections.description: Dr. Graham at OCME said he would set up a phone call between investigators and Dr. Roman.

events.title: Original ligature incident
events.description: Reference to an original ligature used on Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019.

events.title: Ligature from death
events.description: Reference to a ligature from August 10, 2019, related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Evidence coordination emails
events.description: Email chain discussing forensic evidence coordination regarding Epstein's death, including ligature comparison and setting up a call with the medical examiner.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from August 13, 2019, discussing forensic evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
There is discussion about comparing the original ligature used on Epstein on July 23, 2019, with the ligature from August 10, 2019.
A medical examiner stated it was not possible to reliably determine a time of death, especially within the tight timeframe already established.
Investigators were working on obtaining interviews with those who discovered Epstein's body but faced legalities.
